description: Least palindrome containing the digits of n as a subsequence.
example: The smallest palindrome containing 21 as a subsequence is 121. So a(21) = 121.
mathematica: Do[k = 1; While[ StringPosition[ ToString[k], ToString[n]] == {} || ToString[k] != StringReverse[ ToString[k]], k++ ]; Print[k], {n, 1, 70} ]
author: _Joseph L. Pe_, Feb 10 2002
extensions: Edited and extended by _Robert G. Wilson v_, Feb 12 2002
